WRITING.TITLE: Billie Joe Armstrong on TV Show Junk Gypsy

WRITING.TEXT:
If it does have to be from an actual poem, Edgar Allan Poe has some interesting poems, here's "Alone"....also, the spelling may seem off, but this is due to the poem being published in 1875
From childhood's hour I have not been
As others were -- I have not seen
As others saw -- I could not bring
My passions from a common spring --
From the same source I have not taken
My sorrow -- I could not awaken
My heart to joy at the same tone --
And all I lov'd -- I lov'd alone --
Then -- in my childhood -- in the dawn
Of a most stormy life -- was drawn
From ev'ry depth of good and ill
The mystery which binds me still --
From the torrent, or the fountain --
From the red cliff of the mountain --
From the sun that 'round me roll'd
In its autumn tint of gold --
From the lightning in the sky
As it pass'd me flying by --
From the thunder, and the storm --
And the cloud that took the form
(When the rest of Heaven was blue)
Of a demon in my view --
Does it have to specifically be a poem? I mean, you could use Carpe Diem since it's written in the style of a poem

WRITING.TEXT:
I feel as though the new DLC will add new challenges to the game. For example, heating and keeping your roads in good condition.
It sucks that the weather isn't seasonal though but the maps provided will give players an artistic appeal to their city that the default maps don't really have, and for the price it all seems worth it to me
Yessss! ;D

Thanks! Just trying to explore ways to make it look unique. Most of the cities I've worked on tend to look boring and lack personality so I'm hoping this one will be an improvement on its predecessors
